Lesson 1: New Friends.title: Lesson 1: New Friends
explanations: A は B です is a basic sentence structure meaning 'A is B'. For example: わたしはがくせいです。
You can make a question by adding か at the end of a sentence. For example: あなたはせんせいですか？
の is used to show possession, like an apostrophe-s in English. For example: せんせいのほん (the teacher’s book).

Lesson 2: Shopping.title: Lesson 2: Shopping
grammar_points: これ / それ / あれ
この / その / あの + noun
explanations: これ (this), それ (that), and あれ (that over there) refer to objects depending on location.
この / その / あの are used with nouns. Example: このほん (this book).
も means 'also' or 'too'. Example: わたしもがくせいです (I am a student too).

Lesson 3: Making a Date.title: Lesson 3: Making a Date
explanations: ～をください means 'Please give me ~'. For example: みずをください。
～はどうですか is used to ask for an opinion or suggestion. Example: このえいがはどうですか？
The particle に is used to mark time. Example: にじにあいます (meet at 2 o’clock).
